items.label: extractBasicAuthHeaderValue(http:Request req)(string?)
items.documentation: Extracts the basic authentication header value from the request.

items.label: createHttpCachingClient(string url, http:ClientEndpointConfig config, http:CacheConfig cacheConfig)(ballerina/http:CallerActions)
items.documentation: Creates an HTTP client capable of caching HTTP responses.

items.label: parseHeader(string headerValue)((string,map)|error)
items.documentation: Parses the given header value to extract its value and parameter map.

items.label: invokeEndpoint(string path, http:Request outRequest, FORWARD|GET|POST|DELETE|OPTIONS|PUT|PATCH|HEAD|NONE requestAction, http:CallerActions httpClient)(ballerina/http:Response|error)
items.documentation:
The HEAD action implementation of the Circuit Breaker. This wraps the `head()` function of the underlying
HTTP actions provider.

items.label: createHttpSecureClient(string url, http:ClientEndpointConfig config)(ballerina/http:CallerActions)
items.documentation: Creates an HTTP client capable of securing HTTP requests with authentication.

items.label: encode(string url, string charset)(string|error)
items.documentation: Encodes the given URL.

items.label: decode(string url, string charset)(string|error)
items.documentation: Decodes the given URL.

items.label: HttpServiceConfig
items.documentation: Contains the configurations for an HTTP service.

items.label: CorsConfig
items.documentation: Configurations for CORS support.

items.label: Versioning
items.documentation: Configurations for service versioning.

items.label: WSServiceConfig
items.documentation: Configurations for a WebSocket service.

items.label: HttpResourceConfig
items.documentation: Configuration for an HTTP resource.

items.label: WebSocketUpgradeConfig
items.documentation: Configures the HTTP to WebSocket upgrade.

items.label: ListenerAuthConfig
items.documentation: Configures the authentication scheme for a service or a resource.

items.label: Authentication
items.documentation: Can be used for enabling/disabling authentication in an HTTP service.

items.label: CacheConfig
items.documentation: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the caching behaviour of the endpoint.

items.label: TargetService
items.documentation: Represents a single service and its related configurations.

items.label: ClientEndpointConfig
items.documentation: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the behaviours when communicating with a remote HTTP endpoint.

items.label: RetryConfig
items.documentation: Provides configurations for controlling the retry behaviour in failure scenarios.

items.label: SecureSocket
items.documentation: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

items.label: FollowRedirects
items.documentation: Provides configurations for controlling the endpoint's behaviour in response to HTTP redirect related responses.

items.label: ProxyConfig
items.documentation: Proxy server configurations to be used with the HTTP client endpoint.

items.label: ConnectionThrottling
items.documentation: Provides configurations for throttling connections of the endpoint.

items.label: AuthConfig
items.documentation: AuthConfig record can be used to configure the authentication mechanism used by the HTTP endpoint.

items.label: HttpTimeoutError
items.documentation: Defines a timeout error occurred during service invocation.

items.label: TrustStore
items.documentation: A record for providing trust store related configurations.

items.label: KeyStore
items.documentation: A record for providing key store related configurations.

items.label: Protocols
items.documentation: A record for configuring SSL/TLS protocol and version to be used.

items.label: ValidateCert
items.documentation: A record for providing configurations for certificate revocation status checks.

items.label: ServiceOcspStapling
items.documentation: A record for providing configurations for certificate revocation status checks.

items.label: CompressionConfig
items.documentation: A record for providing configurations for content compression.

items.label: FailoverClientEndpointConfiguration
items.documentation: Provides a set of HTTP related configurations and failover related configurations.

items.label: FailoverConfig
items.documentation: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the failover behaviour of the endpoint.

items.label: FailoverInferredConfig
items.documentation: Inferred failover configurations passed into the failover client.

items.label: CircuitHealth
items.documentation: Maintains the health of the Circuit Breaker.

items.label: CircuitBreakerConfig
items.documentation: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the behaviour of the Circuit Breaker.

items.label: RollingWindow
items.documentation: Represents a rolling window in the Circuit Breaker.

items.label: Bucket
items.documentation: Represents a discrete sub-part of the time window (Bucket).

items.label: CircuitBreakerInferredConfig
items.documentation: Derived set of configurations from the `CircuitBreakerConfig`.

items.label: LoadBalanceActionErrorData
items.documentation: Represents an error occurred in an action of the Load Balance connector.

items.label: RetryInferredConfig
items.documentation: Derived set of configurations from the `RetryConfig`.

items.label: LoadBalanceClientEndpointConfiguration
items.documentation: The configurations related to the load balance client endpoint.

items.label: Remote
items.documentation: Presents a read-only view of the remote address.

items.label: Local
items.documentation: Presents a read-only view of the local address.

items.label: RequestLimits
items.documentation: Configures limits for requests. If these limits are violated, the request is rejected.

items.label: ServiceEndpointConfiguration
items.documentation: Provides a set of configurations for HTTP service endpoints.

items.label: ServiceSecureSocket
items.documentation: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for HTTP service.

items.label: AuthCacheConfig
items.documentation: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the authorization caching behaviour of the endpoint.

items.label: AuthProvider
items.documentation: Configuration for authentication providers.

items.label: WebSocketClientEndpointConfig
items.documentation: Configuration struct for WebSocket client endpoint.

items.label: AuthHandlerRegistry
items.documentation: Representation of the Http Auth Handler Registry.

items.label: AuthnFilter
items.documentation: Representation of the Authentication filter.

items.label: HttpAuthnHandler
items.documentation: Representation of Authentication handler for HTTP traffic.

items.label: AuthnHandlerChain
items.documentation: Representation of Authentication handler chain

items.label: AuthzFilter
items.documentation: Representation of the Authorization filter

items.label: HttpAuthzHandler
items.documentation: Representation of Authorization Handler for HTTP

items.label: HttpBasicAuthnHandler
items.documentation: Defines Basic Auth handler for HTTP traffic.

items.label: HttpJwtAuthnHandler
items.documentation: Representation of JWT Auth handler for HTTP traffic

items.label: RequestCacheControl
items.documentation: Configures cache control directives for a `Request`.

items.label: ResponseCacheControl
items.documentation: Configures cache control directives for a `Response`.

items.label: HttpCachingClient
items.documentation: An HTTP caching client implementation which takes an `HttpActions` instance and wraps it with an HTTP caching layer.

items.label: HttpFuture
items.documentation:
Represents a 'future' that returns as a result of an asynchronous HTTP request submission.
This can be used as a reference to fetch the results of the submission.

items.label: PushPromise
items.documentation: Represents an HTTP/2 `PUSH_PROMISE` frame.

items.label: Filter
items.documentation: Representation of a HTTP Request Filter. This filter will be applied before the request is dispatched to the relevant resource. Any Filter implementation should be structurally similar to the Filter object.

items.label: FilterContext
items.documentation: Representation of request filter Context.

items.label: Request
items.documentation: Represents an HTTP request.

items.label: Response
items.documentation: Represents an HTTP response.

items.label: HttpSecureClient
items.documentation:
Provides secure HTTP actions for interacting with HTTP endpoints. This will make use of the authentication schemes
configured in the HTTP client endpoint to secure the HTTP requests.

items.label: Service
items.documentation: A representation of an HTTP service instance.

items.label: RedirectClient
items.documentation: Provides redirect functionality for HTTP client actions.

items.label: CircuitBreakerClient
items.documentation: A Circuit Breaker implementation which can be used to gracefully handle network failures.

items.label: LoadBalancerRule
items.documentation: LoadBalancerRule provides a required interfaces to implement different algorithms.

items.label: RetryClient
items.documentation:
Provides the HTTP actions for interacting with an HTTP endpoint. This is created by wrapping the HTTP client
to provide retrying over HTTP requests.

items.label: LoadBalancerRounRobinRule
items.documentation: Implementation of round robin load balancing strategy.

items.label: WebSocketClientService
items.documentation: Represents the WebSocket client service.

items.label: WebSocketService
items.documentation: Represents the WebSocket client service.

items.label: CachingPolicy
items.documentation:
Used for configuring the caching behaviour. Setting the `policy` field in the `CacheConfig` record allows
the user to control the caching behaviour.

items.label: Chunking
items.documentation:
Defines the possible values for the chunking configuration in HTTP services and clients.

`AUTO`: If the payload is less than 8KB, content-length header is set in the outbound request/response,
        otherwise chunking header is set in the outbound request/response
`ALWAYS`: Always set chunking header in the response
`NEVER`: Never set the chunking header even if the payload is larger than 8KB in the outbound request/response

items.label: Compression
items.documentation:
Options to compress using gzip or deflate.

`AUTO`: When service behaves as a HTTP gateway inbound request/response accept-encoding option is set as the
        outbound request/response accept-encoding/content-encoding option
`ALWAYS`: Always set accept-encoding/content-encoding in outbound request/response
`NEVER`: Never set accept-encoding/content-encoding header in outbound request/response

items.label: HttpOperation
items.documentation:
Defines the HTTP operations related to circuit breaker, failover and load balancer.

`FORWARD`: Forward the specified payload
`GET`: Request a resource
`POST`: Create a new resource
`DELETE`: Deletes the specified resource
`OPTIONS`: Request communication options available
`PUT`: Replace the target resource
`PATCH`: Apply partial modification to the resource
`HEAD`: Identical to `GET` but no resource body should be returned
`NONE`: No operation should be performed

items.label: RedirectCode
items.documentation: Defines the HTTP redirect codes as a type.

items.label: CredentialBearer
items.documentation: Specifies how the authentication credentials should be sent when using the refresh token to refresh the access token

items.label: CircuitState
items.documentation:
A finite type for modeling the states of the Circuit Breaker. The Circuit Breaker starts in the `CLOSED` state.
If any failure thresholds are exceeded during execution, the circuit trips and goes to the `OPEN` state. After
the specified timeout period expires, the circuit goes to the `HALF_OPEN` state. If the trial request sent while
in the `HALF_OPEN` state succeeds, the circuit goes back to the `CLOSED` state.

items.label: KeepAlive
items.documentation: Defines the possible values for the keep-alive configuration in service and client endpoints.
